 11: static char help[] = "Test matrix rational function.\n\n";

 13: #include <slepcfn.h>

 15: /*
 16:    Compute matrix rational function B = q(A)\p(A)
 17:  */
 18: PetscErrorCode TestMatRational(FN fn,Mat A,PetscViewer viewer,PetscBool verbose,PetscBool inplace)
 19: {
 20:   PetscBool      set,flg;
 21:   PetscInt       n;
 22:   Mat            F,Acopy;
 23:   Vec            v,f0;
 24:   PetscReal      nrm;

 27:   MatGetSize(A,&n,NULL);
 28:   MatDuplicate(A,MAT_DO_NOT_COPY_VALUES,&F);
 29:   PetscObjectSetName((PetscObject)F,"F");
 30:   /* compute matrix function */
 31:   if (inplace) {
 32:     MatCopy(A,F,SAME_NONZERO_PATTERN);
 33:     MatIsHermitianKnown(A,&set,&flg);
 34:     if (set && flg) MatSetOption(F,MAT_HERMITIAN,PETSC_TRUE);
 35:     FNEvaluateFunctionMat(fn,F,NULL);
 36:   } else {
 37:     MatDuplicate(A,MAT_COPY_VALUES,&Acopy);
 38:     FNEvaluateFunctionMat(fn,A,F);
 39:     /* check that A has not been modified */
 40:     MatAXPY(Acopy,-1.0,A,SAME_NONZERO_PATTERN);
 41:     MatNorm(Acopy,NORM_1,&nrm);
 42:     if (nrm>100*PETSC_MACHINE_EPSILON) PetscPrintf(PETSC_COMM_WORLD,"Warning: the input matrix has changed by %g\n",(double)nrm);
 43:     MatDestroy(&Acopy);
 44:   }
 45:   if (verbose) {
 46:     PetscPrintf(PETSC_COMM_WORLD,"Matrix A - - - - - - - -\n");
 47:     MatView(A,viewer);
 48:     PetscPrintf(PETSC_COMM_WORLD,"Computed f(A) - - - - - - -\n");
 49:     MatView(F,viewer);
 50:   }
 51:   /* print matrix norm for checking */
 52:   MatNorm(F,NORM_1,&nrm);
 53:   PetscPrintf(PETSC_COMM_WORLD,"The 1-norm of f(A) is %g\n",(double)nrm);
 54:   /* check FNEvaluateFunctionMatVec() */
 55:   MatCreateVecs(A,&v,&f0);
 56:   MatGetColumnVector(F,f0,0);
 57:   FNEvaluateFunctionMatVec(fn,A,v);
 58:   VecAXPY(v,-1.0,f0);
 59:   VecNorm(v,NORM_2,&nrm);
 60:   if (nrm>100*PETSC_MACHINE_EPSILON) PetscPrintf(PETSC_COMM_WORLD,"Warning: the norm of f(A)*e_1-v is %g\n",(double)nrm);
 61:   MatDestroy(&F);
 62:   VecDestroy(&v);
 63:   VecDestroy(&f0);
 64:   return 0;
 65: }

 67: int main(int argc,char **argv)
 68: {
 69:   FN             fn;
 70:   Mat            A=NULL;
 71:   PetscInt       i,j,n=10,np,nq;
 72:   PetscScalar    *As,p[10],q[10];
 73:   PetscViewer    viewer;
 74:   PetscBool      verbose,inplace,matcuda;

 77:   SlepcInitialize(&argc,&argv,(char*)0,help);
 78:   PetscOptionsGetInt(NULL,NULL,"-n",&n,NULL);
 79:   PetscOptionsHasName(NULL,NULL,"-verbose",&verbose);
 80:   PetscOptionsHasName(NULL,NULL,"-inplace",&inplace);
 81:   PetscOptionsHasName(NULL,NULL,"-matcuda",&matcuda);
 82:   PetscPrintf(PETSC_COMM_WORLD,"Matrix rational function, n=%" PetscInt_FMT ".\n",n);

 84:   /* Create rational function r(x)=p(x)/q(x) */
 85:   FNCreate(PETSC_COMM_WORLD,&fn);
 86:   FNSetType(fn,FNRATIONAL);
 87:   np = 2; nq = 3;
 88:   p[0] = -3.1; p[1] = 1.1;
 89:   q[0] = 1.0; q[1] = -2.0; q[2] = 3.5;
 90:   FNRationalSetNumerator(fn,np,p);
 91:   FNRationalSetDenominator(fn,nq,q);
 92:   FNSetFromOptions(fn);

 94:   /* Set up viewer */
 95:   PetscViewerASCIIGetStdout(PETSC_COMM_WORLD,&viewer);
 96:   FNView(fn,viewer);
 97:   if (verbose) PetscViewerPushFormat(viewer,PETSC_VIEWER_ASCII_MATLAB);

 99:   /* Create matrices */
100:   if (matcuda) {
101: #if defined(PETSC_HAVE_CUDA)
102:     MatCreateSeqDenseCUDA(PETSC_COMM_SELF,n,n,NULL,&A);
103: #endif
104:   } else MatCreateSeqDense(PETSC_COMM_SELF,n,n,NULL,&A);
105:   PetscObjectSetName((PetscObject)A,"A");

107:   /* Fill A with a symmetric Toeplitz matrix */
108:   MatDenseGetArray(A,&As);
109:   for (i=0;i<n;i++) As[i+i*n]=2.0;
110:   for (j=1;j<3;j++) {
111:     for (i=0;i<n-j;i++) { As[i+(i+j)*n]=1.0; As[(i+j)+i*n]=1.0; }
112:   }
113:   MatDenseRestoreArray(A,&As);
114:   MatSetOption(A,MAT_HERMITIAN,PETSC_TRUE);
115:   TestMatRational(fn,A,viewer,verbose,inplace);

117:   /* Repeat with same matrix as non-symmetric */
118:   MatSetOption(A,MAT_HERMITIAN,PETSC_FALSE);
119:   TestMatRational(fn,A,viewer,verbose,inplace);

121:   MatDestroy(&A);
122:   FNDestroy(&fn);
123:   SlepcFinalize();
124:   return 0;
125: }

127: /*TEST

141:       test:

146: TEST*/
